body:
Those screenshots are from the Ruqqus Discord. You can tell because of the colored names and fake pronoun nicknames. This was most likely done using the "inspect element" developer tools. Discord screenshots can't be trusted.

Edit: Aight I was wrong to discount it so quickly - OP does bring up some good points. Still, just like it shouldn't be discounted as trolling immediately, it shouldn't be praised as truth either. Claims like this require investigation to build or take down a case.

body:
Whether this is real or not, does not really matter.

What matters is - **shills are always organizing attacks on free-speech communities**. This is a fact, not a theory. What we see here is just one (possible) example.

Fact is, Ruqqus [has already seen such attacks](https://ruqqus.com/+TheMemery/post/4n0q/psa-ruqqus-is-under-shill-attack) - and the larger it grows, the more such attacks it will continue seeing.

There is **only one way** to defend a community against shills without assuming the role of an overarching censor - educate each and every user on shill tactics, and let guild leaders do the job on their guild, while the users help out with votes.

For this reason, I have brought back +ShillWall over from Saidit. This guild has three roles:  

* The first, main role, is to provide resources for users to self-educate about shill tactics. The more users recognize and call out obvious shills, the harder their work gets - up to the point where they have no influence, once the majority (over half) of the users recognize them.

* The second, still important role, is post stuff like this, exposing the currently active shills.

* Lastly, it's a place to talk and organize in general.

Hope this helps keep Ruqqus one of the few remaining bastions of free, (largely) shill free discussion.

body:
>The moment we gave these degenerates an inch of freedom, they do things like this to try to control the few freedoms we have left.

The "alt-right" has attracted a mutant breed of weebs who think hating women and wanting the world to end makes them anti-liberal and therefore conservative. 4chan is a big part of this. These subhumans think they are one of us and go into untethered meltdowns whenever they feel ostracized. 

I've been under attack by @FaustAlexander and his dozens of alts for the past few days, most of them have variations of the name "fuck_milkit" and "i_hate_milkit" or "subculture_guardian_pussy".  Our crime is speaking unkindly of hentai and furry addicts on ruqqus I guess. Subhumans like this are happy to hop onto VPNs and create alts all day. They have no life and behave more like bots (which I wouldn't be surprised if they were). I have already seen what these kind of "people" do on 4chan and reddit and if the same thing is happening here it just reminds me of how inferior the internet is to real groups of people. 

We are surrounded by bots and mentally ill people who have sold out or been sold out since birth, they are enabled online in a way they aren't in real life. In real life nobody respects them or wants to hear from them, they are visibly deranged. On the internet they run wild even in our most vigilant and fair communities. They can't be reasoned with and I'm not interested in hiding from them with a private profile or constantly battling them. In the end I'm inclined to just do what I did in the past and step away from all "discourse" on the internet. **I'm tired of interacting with bots and literal subhuman zombies.**

parent.body:
>The moment we gave these degenerates an inch of freedom, they do things like this to try to control the few freedoms we have left.

The "alt-right" has attracted a mutant breed of weebs who think hating women and wanting the world to end makes them anti-liberal and therefore conservative. 4chan is a big part of this. These subhumans think they are one of us and go into untethered meltdowns whenever they feel ostracized. 

I've been under attack by @FaustAlexander and his dozens of alts for the past few days, most of them have variations of the name "fuck_milkit" and "i_hate_milkit" or "subculture_guardian_pussy".  Our crime is speaking unkindly of hentai and furry addicts on ruqqus I guess. Subhumans like this are happy to hop onto VPNs and create alts all day. They have no life and behave more like bots (which I wouldn't be surprised if they were). I have already seen what these kind of "people" do on 4chan and reddit and if the same thing is happening here it just reminds me of how inferior the internet is to real groups of people. 

We are surrounded by bots and mentally ill people who have sold out or been sold out since birth, they are enabled online in a way they aren't in real life. In real life nobody respects them or wants to hear from them, they are visibly deranged. On the internet they run wild even in our most vigilant and fair communities. They can't be reasoned with and I'm not interested in hiding from them with a private profile or constantly battling them. In the end I'm inclined to just do what I did in the past and step away from all "discourse" on the internet. **I'm tired of interacting with bots and literal subhuman zombies.**

body:
To clear things up because of the new leaked link today: this is probably bullshit. If you look closely at the screenshots you can see the roles and setups don't even line up with each other, meaning they probably came from multiple different servers (I think some of the pics may even be from servers I'm in). It's just convenient because every time there's any kind of group server, certain users are *nearly always* invited (such as luk, villain, seq, notabot, angst, etc). I have no idea why they are always invited to everything immediately, but that's what I've observed. It was probably one of them that took the screenshots too, since they're in all those servers.

In any case you can tell almost all these messages are taken out of context and/or sarcastic.

I have no idea why they are always invited to everything immediately, but that's what I've observed. It was probably one of them that took the screenshots too, since they're in all those servers.

In any case you can tell almost all these messages are taken out of context and/or sarcastic.

There, they took screenshots of many prominent Ruqqus users on a secret Discord server conspiring to control Ruqqus for nefarious purposes. As shown in the screenshots, many of these users confirmed that they are allied with the CCP and AHS, an organization from Reddit that seeks to destroy free speech at any opportunity. Some of these users are actively being paid to manipulate Ruqqus in favor of these third parties. We need to do something about this immediately.
